name: 5'8 x 19 1/8 x 2 1/8 - Toy Factory Rip Shred - By Lee Bartlett.
description:
Used by our Irish team rider Gearoid. This is a custom rip shred with KE artwok. One repair (professionally repaired) apart from that is in very condition. 

RIP SHRED IS A SHORT BOARD THAT IS DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE HIGH PERFORMANCE IN FUN WAVES. ASK OLI ADAMS! BEST BOARD TO HAVE TO TAKE YOU TO THE NEXT LEVEL. THIS IS ONE OF THE BOARDS THAT OLI ADAMS AND LEE BARTLETT HAVE SPENT A LOT OF TIME DESIGNING AND FINE TUNING.

ITS GREAT FOR WHEN ITS PUMPING, PUT THIS IN GOOD WAVES AND WE DARE YOU NOT TO COME OUT WITH A SMILE ON YOUR FACE.

SURF THIS BOARD AND RELEASE YOUR INNER PERFORMANCE!

name: 5'6 x 18 5/8 x 2 1/8 4th by Luke Hart - Mad Fresh - Made for Harry deRoth
description:
Good condition board. This was made for Harry deRoth so perfect for a grom, this would make some young surfers Christmas. 



THE OVERVIEW

Well the Mad Fresh is basically a board that takes the novelty out of the shorter wider boards, still shorter, still flatter and still plenty of volume along with added rail length and more curve into the pulled in tail, the Mad Fresh is an evolution of the progressive shortboard and something that is as happy in the air as it is getting flung on rail or holding in the pocket. get Mad Fresh on it, lets see what the new skool has…

THE CONCEPT

The Mad Fresh is basically what you need in a shorter wider board to make it better on rail with more hold in the pocket, enabling not just airs and rotations but tighter radius turns in the pocket to really push the limit of high performance surfing. basically the easier a board is to surf the easier it is to progress, and this is just a follow on from design working on boards like the Jeffrey, the Fly-Ty, the Stoker and the Blue Canvas to some extent.

It’s the evolution of having a few years on the wider boards coupled with the great feeling you get from carving lines when its pumping and doing big hacks right in the pocket on your shortboard. I’m so excited about this model as are the team, the footage we have been getting speaks for itself!

THE TECH’ STUFF

The Mad Fresh features a somewhat stretched out outline of the Fly-Ty, with softer curves and a more performance based tail shape (like the Crow model), this allows a lot of drive with the straight rail, but also plenty of pivot off the back foot due to the slight hip and pulled in tail, as for the rocker it has a curvy high-ish tail rocker for hold right in the pocket and a drawn out flatter rocker through the nose with a touch of flip, this combination allows late take-offs, hard off the bottom turning and a lot of forward momentum.

The concaves are very similar to the Blue Canvas model just with a touch deeper single concave through the nose, the idea of the concave is to give you plenty of lift in the water for speed, also with the boxy shortboard rail the Mad Fresh has you sit slightly higher in the water than a shortboard which makes it very easy to throw about in less than perfect surf. The fin set up is that of a standard shortboard to offer maximum drive and torque on carves and hacks and the volume spread is fairly compact just like the new skool wide and short boards you see everyone riding today. this combination of design meets evolution really gives you a tool to push the tweaks and the power in your surfing in a wider range of conditions.

THE STATS

Wave Height: 2-6 foot
Ability Level: Intermediate to pro
Fin Set Up: Thruster
Rails: Boxy
Tail Rocker: Medium high
Nose Rocker: Low
Concave: Single to double
Tail: Squash
Size: Try 1-4 inches shorter and half to 1 inch wider than your standard board

name: 5'9 x 18 5/16 x 2 1/6 Mad Fresh 4th by Luke Hart - Made for Hazza T
description:
3rd one of Hazza T's. Similar condition but price reflective. Slightly longer and wider this one so bit more of a short board for a average to good surfer who is looking for a board for a trip or to surf in good to perfect waves. Again as low as we can go 

THE OVERVIEW

Well the Mad Fresh is basically a board that takes the novelty out of the shorter wider boards, still shorter, still flatter and still plenty of volume along with added rail length and more curve into the pulled in tail, the Mad Fresh is an evolution of the progressive shortboard and something that is as happy in the air as it is getting flung on rail or holding in the pocket. get Mad Fresh on it, lets see what the new skool has…

THE CONCEPT

The Mad Fresh is basically what you need in a shorter wider board to make it better on rail with more hold in the pocket, enabling not just airs and rotations but tighter radius turns in the pocket to really push the limit of high performance surfing. basically the easier a board is to surf the easier it is to progress, and this is just a follow on from design working on boards like the Jeffrey, the Fly-Ty, the Stoker and the Blue Canvas to some extent.

It’s the evolution of having a few years on the wider boards coupled with the great feeling you get from carving lines when its pumping and doing big hacks right in the pocket on your shortboard. I’m so excited about this model as are the team, the footage we have been getting speaks for itself!

THE TECH’ STUFF

The Mad Fresh features a somewhat stretched out outline of the Fly-Ty, with softer curves and a more performance based tail shape (like the Crow model), this allows a lot of drive with the straight rail, but also plenty of pivot off the back foot due to the slight hip and pulled in tail, as for the rocker it has a curvy high-ish tail rocker for hold right in the pocket and a drawn out flatter rocker through the nose with a touch of flip, this combination allows late take-offs, hard off the bottom turning and a lot of forward momentum.

The fin set up is that of a standard shortboard to offer maximum drive and torque on carves and hacks and the volume spread is fairly compact just like the new skool wide and short boards you see everyone riding today. this combination of design meets evolution really gives you a tool to push the tweaks and the power in your surfing in a wider range of conditions.

THE STATS

Wave Height: 2-6 foot
Ability Level: Intermediate to pro
Fin Set Up: Thruster
Rails: Boxy
Tail Rocker: Medium high
Nose Rocker: Low
Concave: Single to double
Tail: Squash
Size: Try 1-4 inches shorter and half to 1 inch wider than your standard board

description:
Another of Harry Timson boards, not as good condition as the others. But still a very good board. Another good wave board or lighter good surfer grom board. 
This one is as low as we can go.

name: 5'7 x 19 1/4 x 2 1/4 Skindog small wave board
description: This is a small wave board made by Skindog surfboards. Very good condition board for a great price.

name: 6'0 x 21 1/2 x 2 5/8 Burger Monster - With KE artwork Spray
description:
Discounted board due to small repair under artwork. There is no effect to performance. 

THE BURGER MONSTER IS DESIGNED FOR THOSE WEAK FAT WAVES YOU STILL WANT TO SURF OR IF YOU JUST WANT A HIGH WAVE COUNT.

THIS IS A PERFECT SUMMER BOARD AND GREAT FOR A BEGINNER TO AN ADVANCED SURFER. ITS THAT BOARD YOU WISH YOU HAD WHEN ITS SMALL OFFSHORE BUT JUST THAT LITTLE TO SMALL FOR YOUR NORMAL BOARD.

THIS BOARD WILL HAVE YOU SURFING EVEN WHEN THE WAVES ARE WEAK!

THE BURGER MONSTER BY TOY FACTORY SURFBOARDS CAN BE RIDDEN ABOUT 5-6 INCHES SHORTER THAN YOUR NORMAL BOARD. CHECK OUT THE VIDEO BELOW.

name: 5'7 x 18 3/8 x 2 3/16 4th by Luke Hart - Stoker (made for Alan Stokes)
description:
This is a 5'7 Stoker made for Alan Stokes. It was used in his Mexico edit for strange beautiful life.


OVERVIEW

Easy to ride, care free surfing craft that’s fun for everyone, paddles well, super fast down the line and great for any level of surfing depending on who rides it.

THE CONCEPT

The Stoker, a rework on design from stokesys first ever pro model. A super easy to surf and fun board. The Stoker is a board for total freesurfing expression. Whether you want to practice your airs, throw some rotation in the mix or whack the fins out, this is the ultimate tool for pure fun and stoke. They are addictive little things! Order 4-6 inches shorter than your standard shortboard.

THE TECH STUFF

The Stoker has elements of Stokesy’s original pro model with new tweaks, enabling a progression to what Stokesy wants to achieve when he gets in the water for a freesurf. He wants to blow up and have some fun. We’ve added more drive to the Stoker with a slightly more parallel rail and pulled the tail shape in slightly to get more hold on a bottom turn, dropped the rail shape down a touch to increase rail hold through bigger turns and lengthened the board an inch whilst raising the nose rocker to enable the board to hold in on tight pockets and waves with a lot of shape. Most importantly this is a ‘do everything’ board. Just get it out there and have some fun. It goes when it’s small due to the deck volume and extra nose width and is also fun in bigger waves with the added length delivering increased hold. The deep single running throughout the board provides lift in the water which helps with initial speed and paddling. We are stoked with what we have come up with in this board and can’t wait to get people on it, carving their own lines and taking their surfing to the next level.

THE STATS

Rail – medium high, shortboard like
Tail rocker – super high tail kick
Nose rocker – low medium
Concave – deep single
Tail – Squash
Size – order 4-6 inches shorter, 1/4 to half inches wider and 1/8 thinner than your go to stick. Or email us to talk about it some more.
Wave height – you tell us, Stokesy usually takes it in whenever he wants to surf.
Ability level – this is a board for everyone.
Fin setup – thruster as standard

name: 5'9 x 17 3/4 x 2 1/2 4th by Luke Hart - Mad Fresh
description:
Made for Harry Timson this is a custom Mad Fresh. Used in France this is a great good wave board or something for a lighter grom. 
Not bad condition but is reflected in price. Still a few miles in the old girl yet, thats for sure. 

Details on the Mad Fresh

THE OVERVIEW

Well the Mad Fresh is basically a board that takes the novelty out of the shorter wider boards, still shorter, still flatter and still plenty of volume along with added rail length and more curve into the pulled in tail, the Mad Fresh is an evolution of the progressive shortboard and something that is as happy in the air as it is getting flung on rail or holding in the pocket. get Mad Fresh on it, lets see what the new skool has…

name: FCS Matt Biolos GMB-5 PC Thruster Fin Set
description:
The GMB set of three fins in the performance core construction is a great way of getting a set of fins for riders between 75-90kg who are looking for a set of fins which offer lots of hold to be used in all conditions that also look sick.
Size

Base:4.41" / 112.0mm
Depth:4.74" / 120.0mm
Area:15.26"2 / 9847mmsup>2
Sweep:32.9°
Foil:Flat

name: FCS - K2.1 PC Thruster set
description:
FCS - K2.1 PC Thruster Fin Set (Performance Core/Medium)
The K2.1 Fins from FCS are Kelly Slater's signature fin set. The main points to these fins are that Kelly rides these to win his many titles which could be considered the best seling point ever, BUT, this fins also pack a lot of punch. They have the feeling of a traditional glassed on fin with the performance aspect increased with the light weight construction of the Performance Core. It's an impressive bit of kit which can be ultilised by all.

-Medium template

-Performance Core construction by FCS

-Base: 4.33" / 110mm

-Depth: 4.53" / 115mm

-Area: 15.23"² / 9824mm

-Sweep: 32.0

name: FCS K-3 Tri fin set
description:
FCS - K-3 PC Tri Fin Set (Medium/Carbon Fibre/PC)
The FCS K-3 was designed in conjunction with Kelly Slater and until now has been available in Glass Flex and Performance Glass. The new FCS K-3 in Performance Core (PC) further enhances this popular template.

Features:

Material: Performance Core (PC)

Performance Core material and construction is designed to deliver the feeling of a traditional fibreglass fin with the added performance of reduced weight. The RTM (Resin Transfer Moulding) process produces a lightweight fin with remarkable flex, a smooth feel and an impressive aesthetic.

Specifications:

Optimum Weight Range: 140-175lbs / 65-80kg 

Sweep: 31 degrees (Center Fin)

The more sweep, the longer the turning arc. The less sweep, the more pivotal the board will be.

Base: 4.45 in. 113 mm (Side Fin)
Base: 4.28 in. 109 mm (Center Fin)

The base affects the amount of drive the board will have. The more base, the more area the fin has to push against the water and therefore the more drive. The less base, the shorter the turning arc.

Depth: 4.61 in. 117 mm (Side Fin)
Depth: 4.41 in. 112 mm (Center Fin) 

The depth that the fin penetrates into the water. It affects the hold and control that the fin has in a turn. The shorter the depth, the more slide a board will have. The longer the depth, the more hold, especially with centre fins.

Surface Area: 15.11 in 9750 mm2 (Side Fin)
Surface Area: 14.22 in. 9172 mm2 (Center Fin)

Foil: IFT

Refers to the shape and geometry of the inside and outside faces of the fin. Foils directly affect the flow of water over the surface of the fin. Different foils create variations in water flow and have a direct link to the overall performance of the fin and the board.

name: FCS AM-3 Thruster fins
description:
FCS - AM3 PC Tri Fin Set (Small/Green)
Al Merrick's small size signature template. Produces exceptional drive while offering quick release and fast directional changes through turns. Favours lighter surfers looking for a high performance fin.

Performance Core material and construction is designed to deliver the feeling of a traditional fibreglass fin with the added performance of reduced weight. The RTM (Resin Transfer Moulding) process produces a lightweight fin with remarkable flex, a smooth feel and an impressive aesthetic.

Features: 

Base: 4.38in - Depth: 4.37in - Sweep: 35.5in - Area: 13.71in - Foil: FLAT
Performance Core construction

Stiff, lightweight fin with a highly responsive tip flex
Al Merrick hex logo print

name: FCS AM-2 Thruster fins
description:
FCS - AM-2 Tri Fin Set (Medium/Orange/PC)
Features:

Material: Performance Core

Performance Core material and construction is designed to deliver the feeling of a traditional fibreglass fin with the added performance of reduced weight. The RTM (Resin Transfer Moulding) process produces a lightweight fin with remarkable flex, a smooth feel and an impressive aesthetic.

Specifications:

Optimum Weight Range: 130-180lbs / 60-80 kg

Sweep: 36.6 degrees (Side Fin)
Sweep: 35 degrees (Center Fin)

The more sweep, the longer the turning arc. The less sweep, the more pivotal the board will be.

Base: 4.55" 116.0mm (Side Fin)
Base: 4.34" 110.0mm (Center Fin)

The base affects the amount of drive the board will have. The more base, the more area the fin has to push against the water and therefore the more drive. The less base, the shorter the turning arc.

Depth: 4.52" 115.0mm (Side Fin)
Depth: 4.41" 112.0mm (Center Fin) 

The depth that the fin penetrates into the water. It affects the hold and control that the fin has in a turn. The shorter the depth, the more slide a board will have. The longer the depth, the more hold, especially with centre fins.

Surface Area: 14.89"2 9608mm2 (Side Fin)
Surface Area: 13.72"2 8852mm2 (Center Fin)

Foil: IFT

Refers to the shape and geometry of the inside and outside faces of the fin. Foils directly affect the flow of water over the surface of the fin. Different foils create variations in water flow and have a direct link to the overall performance of the fin and the board.

name: FCS M.R - TFX tri fins
description:
Mark Richards template with stiff carbon base for twin, super twin or fish set ups. Available with a dynamic stabilising centre fin. Twin

Base: 5.06" 128.0mm
Depth: 5.58" 142.0mm
Area: 21.05"2 13580mm2
Sweep: 33.0°

Stabilizer
Base: 3.55" 90.0mm
Depth: 3.66" 93.0mm
Area: 9.61"2 6200mm2
Sweep: 31.0°

name: 5'8'' x 18' 3/8'' x 2' 3/16'' Quiver by Darcy Surfboard
description:
5'8'' x 18' 3/8'' x 2' 3/16'' Quiver by Darcy Surfboard, shortboard 
Excellent Condition

About: 
You are bidding on a 5'8'' Quiver by Darcy. This is a great board that was a custom order hand shaped by Darcy when he was in UK last summer. Its in excellent condition and only surfed a few times. It has custom poska artwork on the deck. Its has a thruster genuine FCS fin set up. 
Its a great board for most surfers, will work in most waves, would be perfect for a trip or holiday board. Light but strong glass job with carbon tail patchs for even more strength and longevity. Comes with deck pad included. Does not come with fins. 

Can arrange courier or pick up from Newquay area. If you would like to see some more images please private message us. 

Condition:
Almost brand new, its been surfed a few times so has some small pressure dings and a few scratches from being transported but overall is still in excellent condition

name: 5'6 x 19 x 2 1/8 Custom 4th by Luke Hart
description: This is a custom prototype of a model we are releasing this year. Its in good condition with no dings only a few pressure dents on the deck. Half board top and bottom resin tint, thruster FCS. No fins inc.

name: FCS day runner board bags
description:
FCS - 6'0 Dayrunner Shortboard Bag (Pro Blue)
The FCS Dayrunner has always been the best day bag on the market, that's a fact. Hundreds of thousands of surfers trust the Dayrunner on trips and now it's improved ten fold. The new feature to this already perfect boardbag is the 3D Fit technology which provides a perfect fit whilst still allowing your board to breathe. The 3D vent which is placed 3/4 of the length of the board stretches to fit your stick and is reinforced with a rubber mesh to protect your stringer. Clever stuff!

This is the SHORTBOARD shape which we recommend with boards up to 20in width - if you're ensure, please contact us.
5mm thickness, fully padded throughout
Non rust plastic zippers
Detatchable shoulder straps
Reinforced, comfy carry handle

name: FCS stretch board sock - 6'0 (green and blue stripe)
description: This 6ft3 surfboard sock stretch cover is the cost effective solution to protecting your surfboard. The terry towelling bag protects against dirt/dust knocks and the sun, and also keeps surf wax off the inside of your car...

name: FCS stretch board sock - (6'0 Red and Grey stripe)
description: This 6ft3 surfboard sock stretch cover is the cost effective solution to protecting your surfboard. The terry towelling bag protects against dirt/dust knocks and the sun, and also keeps surf wax off the inside of your car...

description: Adriano de souza signature pad.

name: Gorilla deck pad - Ford
description:
Ford Archbold signature two piece tailpad with no archbar, a high performance shortboard pad.

Block Wedge

Steeper more compact wedge to lock your foot in place
tapered at the rails to minimize water drag

name: Gorilla deck pad  - Rosza
description:
Copperhead Arch

A 3-dimensional, tapered, delta-shaped arch
Designed to lock the foot into the back of the pad for hard turning
Increased sensitivity when the foot is forward in a trimming position
High-density foam
Block Wedge

Steeper more compact wedge to lock your foot in place
tapered at the rails to minimize water drag

name: Gorilla deck pad - Medina
description:
One Piece Pad

Copperhead Arch

A 3-dimensional, tapered, delta-shaped arch
Designed to lock the foot into the back of the pad for hard turning
Increased sensitivity when the foot is forward in a trimming position
High-density foam
Roundhouse Wedge

Minimizes interference with water flow around the rails of the tail to reduce drag
Maximises area for adhesion, increasing strength of kick
Minimizes weight
Maintains a moderately high and steep kick for performance surfing

name: The Burger Monster
description:
The Burger Monster

This board is designed for those 
weak fat waves you still want 
to surf or if you just want 
a high wave count.

Vital statistics

•	Super wide
•	Rolled bottom
•	Double concave
•	Boxy rail
•	5 fin set up
•	Suitable for weak waves
This board will have you surfing even when the waves are weak!!

Please note - All our boards are hand made so please allow 3 - 4 weeks from order to delivery.

name: El Bartinez
description:
The El Bartinez

Lee has designed this 
board to be fast, easy 
to surf and great from
rail to rail! The design
will smooth out your 
surfing, keeping it on 
the rail, for hacks, barrels 
and winding up to airs.  
A full on all-rounder!

Vital statistics:

•	Medium rocker
•	Performance rails
•	Deep single concave 
•	Continuous curved outline for ease and smoothness
•	Thruster set up
•	Suitable for 1 -5ft waves

name: The T.O.A.D
description:
The Toad: ( Turns on a dime)

This board is a one board quiver!! 
Either cruise or put it on a rail makes 
no difference. This board loves it!!!

Vital statistics:

•	Less rocker
•	More volume through the nose
•	Single to  double  concave and 
slight V through the tail
•	5 fin set up
•	Jack of all trades
•	Rounded pin/thumb tail
•	Suitable for anything you want to paddle out on
Surf it in more conditions than you can 
shake a stick at!!

All Toy Factory comes as standard with Genuine FCS fins system.

name: The Ripshred
description:
The Ripshred:

This short board is designed to achieve 
high performance on fun waves.  
Ask Oli Adams! Best board to have to 
take you to the next level!!!


Vital Statistics:

•	High rocker
•	Short board rail design
•	Thumb or squash tail
•	 5 fin set up ( thruster or quad)
•	Single to double concave
•	Suitable for 2-5ft waves
Surf this board and release your inner performance!!!

name: The Nu Skool
description:
Nu skool:

Designed for progressive surfing 
this board is short, 
wide, fast and fun! 
This enables airs, rotation’s 
and big hacks in as small 
a board as possible.

Vital statistics:

•	High wide points
•	A lot of rocker through continuous rail curve
•	Single concave
•	5 fin set up(thruster or quad)
•	Suitable for 2-6ft waves
This progressive designed board will have you 
surfing above the lip!!!
